result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy L Wilson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy L Wilson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Jeremy L Wilson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned from 1234 River Rd, WI Dells marked   "Return to Sender, Not deliverable as addressed, Unable to Forward."

Cases heard: 14CF174, 14CF354 & 14CF290, Defendant Jeremy L Wilson in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaints filed; readings waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count 2&3 in 14CF174, ct. 1 in 14CF290, ct. 1&2 in 14CF354. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Court sentenced defendant in 14CF174 on ct. 2 to 60 days jail, huber granted. On ct. 3 to 120 day jail, huber granted, start 12/11/14 at 7 p.m., may transfer to Sauk County Jail. Counts run concurrent with each other. $443 costs on each count. (19 days jail credit)  In 14CF290 & 14CF354, Court withheld sentenced, placed defendant on 2 yr. probation, Conds: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations, no possession/consumption of alcohol. $443 costs on each count. (42 days jail credit in 14CF290 & 26 days credit in 14CF354) Cash bond applied to costs. Ct. 1 in 14CF174 dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Wilson in court with attorney Mark D Lawton.  Brenda L Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is not resolved.  Atty Lawton asked for a preliminary hearing to be set.  Bond remains.  Defendant continues to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Wilson in court with attorney Mark D Lawton.  Brenda L Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is not resolved.  Atty Lawton asked for a preliminary hearing to be set.  Bond remains.  Defendant continues to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Wilson by video, in custody with attorney Mark D Lawton.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to show proof to court that he has a job interview scheduled for Friday 5/02/14.  Case may be heard again on 5/01/14.
